sect2.title: Introduction to libjpeg
sect2.para: The libjpeg package contains libraries that allow compression of image files based on the Joint Photographic Experts Group standard. It is a "lossy" compression algorithm.

sect2.title: Installation of libjpeg
sect2.para: Install libjpeg by running the following commands:

sect2.title: Command explanations
sect2.para: --enable-static --enable-shared: These switches tell libjpeg to build both shared and static libraries.

sect2.title: Contents
sect2.para: The libjpeg package contains cjpeg, djpeg, jpegtran, rdjpgcom, wrjpgcom and libjpeg libraries.

sect3.title: cjpeg
sect3.para: cjpeg compresses image files to produce a JPEG/JFIF file on the standard output. Currently supported input file formats are: PPM (PBMPLUS color format), PGM (PBMPLUS gray-scale format), BMP, and Targa.

sect3.title: djpeg
sect3.para: djpeg decompresses image files from JPEG/JFIF format to either PPM (PBMPLUS color format), PGM (PBMPLUS gray-scale format), BMP, or Targa format.

sect3.title: jpegtran
sect3.para: jpegtran is used for lossless transformation of JPEG files.

sect3.title: rdjpgcom
sect3.para: rdjpgcom displays text comments from within a JPEG file.

sect3.title: wrjpgcom
sect3.para: wrjpgcom inserts text comments into a JPEG file.

sect3.title: jpeg libraries
sect3.para: These libraries are used by many programs for reading and writing jpeg format files.
